lexUnit.name: sole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the underside of a person's foot.

sentence.text: He kicked out as if kicking himself and yelped as his bare feet hit the end of the basket and a sharp end of wicker stabbed into his sole .
Once the little ones had left the room , I shifted my position on the floor and sat cross-legged , trying to cover the soles of my feet with my skirt .
She examined the crossed soles of his feet .
However , when I examined the soles of Brampton 's feet , there were no marks- or cuts .
The kind you feel through the soles of your feet when there 's going to be an earthquake .
That done , he leans over to the other side and does the same thing with his other hand and foot so that both his palms and his soles are anointed with his pungent urine .
It is also found on the palms of the hand and the soles of the feet , which are not sites commonly affected by other rashes .

Your wrists are tied to your ankles , a metal bar is passed under your knees , you are lifted up , hanging from this bar , a wet floor cloth is placed over your face so that you can not breathe , and your head and the soles of your feet and beaten with a leather belt .

He looked at the soles of the feet , making careful note of what he saw .
Nikos is , among other things , a barefoot waterski champion and does the most wonderful tricks flying through the water at 60 mph on nothing but the soles of his size 11 feet !

Using a firm press-release motion , work alternate thumb pads rhythmically over the surface of the sole .
In like manner put your left leg behind you , laying it across your right shoulder ; and be sure to take care that the soles of your feet meet under your chin .
He wore a patched gallibaya and the soles of his feet were split with deep cracks like dried mud .
